pkgmetadata.longdescription: TLP is a collection of scripts enabling laptop-mode and implementing power save features for laptop hardware. See the upstream docs and https://github.com/dywisor/tlp-gentoo-additions.

use.flag: Radio device wizard: switch radios upon network connect/disconnect and dock/undock
Depend on dev-lang/perl. Enables tlp-usblist and allows to use the bundled tpacpi-bat script.
Install an openrc init script. Recommended
Install a systemd service file. EXPERIMENTAL
Allow parallel installation of app-laptop/laptop-mode-tools and app-laptop/tlp. NOT RECOMMENDED
Use the bundled tpacpi-bat script instead of app-laptop/tpacpi-bat.
Enable Thinkpad-specific dependencies for setting/getting battery thresholds etc.
Enable battery control via tpacpi-bat/acpi_call (Sandy Bridge and newer, e.g. X220,T430)
Enable battery control via tp-smapi (older Thinkpad models up to Sandy Bridge Gen 1 (not Ivy Bridge and later))
Use busybox where possible, e.g. for hdparm
Get SMART information from drives that support it.
Use sys-apps/ethtool to control(=disable) Wake on LAN.
If unset, skip installation of X-specific files.
Install tpacpi for Sandy Bridge based Thinkpads
